resources.name: crop_data

fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested. It will generally have been sown the previous year.

fields.name: crop
fields.title: Crop type grown
fields.description: Name of crop grown in this harvest year

fields.name: plot
fields.title: plot number
fields.description: Plot number since 1876, 1-10. Originally 5 plots (1-5) 1856-1875 divided into 10 in 1876. Plots 1 and 2 equivalent to old plot 5, plots 3 and 4 equivalent to old plot 4, etc.

fields.name: fertilizer_code
fields.title: fertilizer and manure treatment code
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer or manure applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fym_factor_level
fields.title: FYM factor level
fields.description: Code for the FYM factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: n_factor_level
fields.title: N factor level
fields.description: Code for the inorganic nitrogen fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fertilizer_n_amount
fields.title: Inorganic fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied to this crop. This does not include N in FYM. No fertilizer N applied to fallow

fields.name: p_factor_level
fields.title: P factor level
fields.description: Code for the phosphorous fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fertilizer_p_amount
fields.title: Inorganic fertilizer P amount
fields.description: Total inorganic P fertilizer applied to this crop. This does not include P in FYM.

fields.name: k_factor_level
fields.title: K factor level
fields.description: Code for the potassium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fertilizer_k_amount
fields.title: Inorganic fertilizer P amount
fields.description: Total inorganic K fertilizer applied to this crop. This does not include K in FYM

fields.name: na_factor_level
fields.title: Na factor level
fields.description: Code for the sodium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fertilizer_na_amount
fields.title: Inorganic fertilizer Na amount
fields.description: Inorganic Na fertilizer applied to this crop as Na factor level. This does not include Na in FYM or as sodium nitrate

fields.name: mg_factor_level
fields.title: Mg factor level
fields.description: Code for the magnesium fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fertilizer_mg_amount
fields.title: Inorganic fertilizer Mg amount
fields.description: Total inorganic Mg fertilizer applied to this crop. This does not include Mg in FYM

fields.name: planting_date_start
fields.title: Planting date start
fields.description: Starting date when the crop was planted (potatoes) or sown (wheat). Winter wheat generally sown in the autumn before harvest

fields.name: planting_date_end
fields.title: Planting date end
fields.description: Last date when the crop was planted (potatoes) or sown (wheat). Winter wheat generally sown in the autumn before harvest

fields.name: harvest_date_start
fields.title: Harvest date start
fields.description: Start date the crop was harvested. No harvest dates 1856-1875

fields.name: harvest_date_end
fields.title: Harvest date end
fields.description: Final date the crop was harvested

fields.name: variety
fields.title: variety
fields.description: Wheat or potato variety or cultivar. All the potato varieties are the white type of potato. The variety Rock was susceptible to late potato blight Phytophthora infestans, the variety Champion, planted from 1880, had high levels of resistance. See Ristaino and Fitt (2012).

fields.name: tuber_%_nitrogen_content
fields.title: tuber percentage nitrogen content
fields.description: Percentage nitrogen content of 'good' tubers at 100% dry matter. See column tuber_good_yield for yield of good tubers. 'Good' tubers are defined as being retained by a 28.6 mm sieve.

fields.name: tuber_nitrogen_content
fields.title: tuber nitrogen content
fields.description: Total nitrogen content of tubers, calculated from percentage N of 'good' tubers and total tuber yield.

fields.name: tuber_good_yield
fields.title: yield of good tubers
fields.description: Yield of good tubers, defined as being retained by a 28.6 mm sieve.

fields.name: tuber_small_yield
fields.title: yield of small tubers
fields.description: Yield of small tubers, defined as passing through a 28.6 mm sieve.

fields.name: tuber_diseased_yield
fields.title: yield of diseased tubers
fields.description: Yield of diseased tubers

fields.name: tuber_total_fresh_weight_yield
fields.title: total fresh weight yield of  tubers
fields.description: Total tuber yield, the sum of good, small and diseased tubers, fresh weight as harvested, at field dry matter content, see column tuber_%_dry_matter for details.

fields.name: tuber_%_dry_matter
fields.title: tuber percentage dry matter
fields.description: Percentage dry matter content of good tubers

fields.name: tuber_total_ dry_matter_yield
fields.title: total dry matter yield of tubers
fields.description: Total tuber yield, the sum of good, small and diseased, at 100 % dry matter, calculated from % dry matter of good tubers,  see column tuber_%_dry_matter for details.

fields.name: grain_yield
fields.title: grain yield
fields.description: Harvested wheat grain yield at field moisture content (approximately 85% dry matter).

fields.name: straw_yield
fields.title: Straw yield
fields.description: Harvested wheat straw yield at field moisture content (approximately 85% dry matter). This does not include stubble. Potato tops not weighed, spread on each plot and ploughed in.

fields.name: note_id
fields.title: Note identification
fields.description: Note number

resources.title: crop yield data
resources.description: The main data table containing annual wheat grain and potato tuber yield data for all plots, and details of all fertilizer and manure treatments, 1856-1901. Also other agronomic information, including sowing/planting and harvest dates, amount and type of fertilizer and manure, and wheat and potato cultivars. The experiment was started in 1856 with four fertilizer treatments. Winter wheat was grown 1856-1874, the whole experiment was fallowed in 1875. In 1876 the original five plots were divided into 10, and several new fertilizer treatments were added. Each plot tested a different fertilizer or manure treatment, applied every year.  Potatoes were grown 1876-1901, yields were recorded for 'good', 'small' and 'diseased' tubers. 'Good' tubers are defined as being retained by a 28.6mm sieve. Potato tuber % dry matter and N content are also shown. Wheat straw yields were recorded in some years, wheat straw was removed at harvest. Potato tops were left on the plots and ploughed in, no yields were recorded.  Wheat grain and straw yields are at field moisture content (approximately 85% dry matter). Potato tuber yields are at both fresh weight and 100% dry matter. Before the experiment was started, unfertilized wheat was grown 1850-1855 (yields not shown).  See notes and plan for further details.

name: exhaustion-land-experiment-annual-crop-yields-1856-1901
title: Exhaustion Land Experiment annual crop yields 1856-1901
description:
### Abstract
This dataset contains crop yield data from Phase 1 of the Exhaustion Land long-term experiment, 1856-1901. Details of the fertilizer and manure treatments, sowing and harvest dates are also included. Winter wheat was grown each year from 1856-1874. The experiment was fallowed in 1875, then potatoes were grown each year from 1876-1901. Potato tuber % dry matter and % N content are also included.
### Methods
The experiment was established in 1856, with four fertilizer and manure treatments, including two nil plots. In 1876 the five plots were divided into 10, and some new fertilizer and manure treatments added. Potatoes were grown each year from 1876-1901. The whole experiment was fallowed (no crop grown) in 1872 and 1875. Yields are given for every year based on the 10 plots present from 1876, thus for 1856-1874 yields from plots 1 and 2 are the same, yields for plots 3 and 4  are the same, etc.
### Technical Info
Crop yields were recorded every year. Wheat grain and straw yields are at field moisture content, approximately 85% dry matter. Potato tuber yields are shown for three categories of tuber: 'good', 'small' and 'diseased'. 'Good' is defined as being retained by a 28.6mm sieve; 'small' pass through this sieve.  Tuber total yield is for 'good' plus 'small' plus 'diseased' tubes. Tuber yield at 100% dry matter was calculated from 'good' tuber % dry matter at harvest and total tuber yield. Tuber N content was calculated from %N content of the 'good' tubers and total tuber yield. The potato tops were not weighed but left on the plots  and ploughed in. Wheat straw yields do not include the stubble.  Before the experiment started, unfertilized wheat was grown 1850-1855.
### Provenance
Annual yields were transcribed from original data sheets held in the Rothamsted paper archive and from the 'Memoranda of the Field and Other Experiments', 1901. Details of treatments were taken from the 'Memoranda of the Field and Other Experiments' 1901, and other publications.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. To ensure quality control during data inputting, the data sets were typed on two separate occasions (double data entry). During the second typing (verification) the data values were compared with those typed on the earlier occasion, and any discrepancies were resolved before verification continued.  This procedure avoided visual checking of data, which can be very inaccurate.
